summary_reasoning: The report fails the quality of assumptions assessment due to multiple internal numeric contradictions and a total lack of quantified sensitivity analysis. While assumptions are explicit and specific regarding magnitudes and time horizons, they fail the consistency and justification pillars. Most critically, the report contains three distinct contradictions: 1) The Stress Capital Buffer (SCB) is stated as 3.7% in the text and model, yet the report’s own cited source (#11) explicitly states the SCB is expected to decrease to 2.5%. 2) The financial estimates table forecasts a year-over-year revenue decline for 2025 ($82.60B to $81.90B), which directly conflicts with the narrative claim that NII (the bank's primary revenue driver) will grow 1-3% in 2025. 3) The Cost of Equity (Ke) is inconsistently applied as 9.5% in the summary and 9.75% in the detailed calculation, leaving the final valuation auditable trail broken. Furthermore, despite identifying material risks such as Commercial Real Estate (CRE) exposure and interest rate volatility, the analyst provides no quantified sensitivity tables or scenario-based valuation ranges. Per the 'Hard Caps' in the instruction, the presence of two or more distinct contradictions, combined with the absence of quantified sensitivities, necessitates a 'Poor' grade.

assumptions_extracted.quote: Board has authorized a massive $40 billion share repurchase program.
WFC’s Stress Capital Buffer (SCB) was finalized at roughly 3.7%.
We model it [efficiency ratio] declining from ~64% in 2025 to ~59% in 2027.
Cost of Equity (Ke): 9.5% (Beta 1.1, Risk-Free Rate 4.25%, Equity Risk Premium 5%).
Management expects full-year 2025 NII to be 1-3% higher than 2024.
Payout Ratio: 85% through 2027 (aggressive capital return), normalizing to 70%.

contradictions.description: SCB is stated as 3.7% in text/tables, but cited source #11 title says 2.5%.
2025 Revenue is estimated to decline in the cover table, but text claims NII will grow 1-3% in 2025.
Cost of Equity (Ke) is listed as 9.5% in the DDM summary but calculated as 9.75% in the detailed appendix.

unjustified_parameters: Terminal growth of 3.0% exceeds the 1.8% GDP growth forecast cited on page 5 without explanation.
